content.question: A golfer strikes a golf ball that is initially on the ground. The ball leaves the ground with initial speed <math alttext="v sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> at an angle <math alttext="theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi></math> to the horizontal and travels toward a vertical wall. The ball collides with the wall at the instant it reaches what would have been its highest point if the wall wasn’t there. The ball rebounds from the wall with the same speed it had when it struck the wall, and then lands at the same point from which it was struck. Which of the following is a correct expression for the horizontal distance between the ball’s initial position and the wall?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator v sub 0, end sub, squared, times the sine of theta, times the cosine of theta, and denominator 2 g, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><msubsup><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn><mn>2</mn></msubsup><mi>sin</mi><mi>θ</mi><mi>cos</mi><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>g</mi></mrow></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator v sub 0, end sub, squared, times the sine of theta, times the cosine of theta, and denominator g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><msubsup><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn><mn>2</mn></msubsup><mi>sin</mi><mi>θ</mi><mi>cos</mi><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mi>g</mi></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator v sub 0, end sub, squared, times the sine squared of theta, and denominator 2 g, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><msubsup><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn><mn>2</mn></msubsup><msup><mi>sin</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>g</mi></mrow></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator v sub 0, end sub, squared, times the sine squared of theta, and denominator g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><msubsup><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn><mn>2</mn></msubsup><msup><mi>sin</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mi>g</mi></mfrac></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator v sub 0, end sub, squared, times the sine of theta, times the cosine of theta, and denominator g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><msubsup><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn><mn>2</mn></msubsup><mi>sin</mi><mi>θ</mi><mi>cos</mi><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mi>g</mi></mfrac></math>
